modules.description: Provides functions for encoding and decoding DNS messages using the Curve25519 elliptic curve cryptography algorithm. Works with byte sequences and DNS message structures to secure communication channels. Enables secure DNS query and response exchanges in network applications.

Provides functions to generate unique identifiers, parse DNS packets from byte buffers, handle timeouts, and marshal DNS packets with encryption using keyrings and box keypairs. Operates on DNS packet structures, byte buffers, and context objects that track state during resolution. Used to securely resolve DNS queries by encrypting and decrypting packets within a cryptographic framework.

Handles cryptographic operations for DNS over Curve25519, including key retrieval, encrypted query and response encoding/decoding, and channel management. Works with public and secret Box keys, DNS buffers, and channel structures to secure DNS communication. Used to process streamlined and TXT-based DNS queries and responses with end-to-end encryption.

Encodes and decodes strings using Base32 encoding, working with sequences of bytes represented as Bigarray arrays. Converts between string representations and byte arrays, supporting efficient data transformation. Processes input strings to generate or extract binary data for storage or transmission.

Extracts DNS packets from context objects, parses encrypted DNS data into context structures, and marshals decrypted packets back into buffer format. Operates on DNS packet buffers and context objects containing cryptographic state. Used to handle encrypted DNS queries and responses in a secure DNS implementation.
